comments:
looks like apple's vm packaging is causing more problem. Debugging anything on I20050324-1400 is 
impossible because of NoSuchMethodErrors.  We're still prepending our jdi.jar to the classpath, but it 
appears that Apple's VirtualMachineManager is getting loaded instead of ours.

From Apple's console...

java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.sun.jdi.VirtualMachineManager.createVirtualMachine(Lcom/sun/jdi/
connect/spi/Connection;)Lcom/sun/jdi/VirtualMachine;
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.ConnectorImpl.establishedConnection(ConnectorImpl.java:98)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketListeningConnectorImpl.accept(SocketListeningConnectorImpl.jav
a:129)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMDebugger$ConnectRunnable.run(StandardVMDebugger.ja
va:78)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:552)

We are incorrectly setting the bootclasspath to a relative path that is being resolved relative to 
Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS instead of the install directory. 

The current setting is -Xbootclasspath/p:plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.debug_3.1.0/jdi.jar. Changing to 
-Xbootclasspath/p:../../../plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.debug_3.1.0/jdi.jar gets the debugger working again.

Not sure what changed to cause this.

IIRC, a few months ago the algorithm for locating the startup.jar inside the eclipse launcher was 
changed. As a consequence I had to replace the argument "startup.jar" in Info.plist to "../../../
startup.jar". It seems that this change applies to the Xbootclasspath too.

However, I have no problems debugging in recent builds and nothing changed for me after replacing 
the "-Xbootclasspath/p:plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.debug_3.1.0/jdi.jar" with "-Xbootclasspath/p:../../../
plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.debug_3.1.0/jdi.jar"

So what exactly is the problem you are experiencing?

Before making the change to Info.plist, my host/target were not connecting when starting a debug 
session. The host would throw the NoSuchMethodError (above) and the debug session was dead.
I thought everyone would have had this problem. I'll try a clean install and see if I can reproduce it.

Tested on N20050325-0010 with new workspace, project, HelloWorld application. The same 
NoSuchMethodError occurs for me (logged to Apple's console).

Eventually the launched process does complete, but the host/target are never able to communicate via 
JDI/JDWP (no threads are ever displayed).

Eclipse Console shows this when the process eventually completes:
Transport error, error code = -1
Hello World

Then there must be a newer change (after 20050315) in the eclipse launcher that I'm not aware of.
I'm using I20050315-1100 which has no problems with debugging.
I tried this both with my current development workspace as well as a new workspace and "Helloworld".

Since I'm currently in the Swiss alps with only a slow modem connection, I'm not able to download a 
more recent build. However, I will fix the Info.plist file in the eclipse launcher.

I have the same problem with 
Version: 3.1.2
Build id: M20060118-1600

The exception is:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2006-06-12 19:20:54.809
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Launching".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.sun.jdi.VirtualMachineManager.createVirtualMachine(Lcom/sun/jdi/connect/spi/Connection;)Lcom/sun/jdi/VirtualMachine;
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.ConnectorImpl.establishedConnection(ConnectorImpl.java:98)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketAttachingConnectorImpl.attach(SocketAttachingConnectorImpl.java:125)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.SocketAttachConnector.connect(SocketAttachConnector.java:139)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.JavaRemoteApplicationLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch(JavaRemoteApplicationLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:79)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:590)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:515)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:733)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:931)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)


Thx
